newsitem.title: SOUTH AFRICA: S.AFRICA APPROVES HIKE IN HIRE-PURCHASE RATE.
newsitem.headline: S.AFRICA APPROVES HIKE IN HIRE-PURCHASE RATE.

text.p: South African Trade and Industry Minister Alec Erwin said on Thursday he had approved a one percentage point increase in the maximum hire-purchase rate.
"Despite the fact that credit extension is not reducing... I have authorised (the) increase in the upper interest rate limit," Erwin told a parliamentary news briefing.
South African banks can currently charge a maximum of 28 percent on hire-purchase contracts.
Erwin said a new Usury Act should be brought before parliamentary committees during the coming year.
"Cabinet has agreed that we should move towards an investigation into the various pyramiding type schemes. This requires further supervision and regulation," he said.

"In the case of gambling, we seek to set up the national gambling board as soon as possible this year...We should be appointing the consultants that will develop the specifications for the national lottery," Erwin added.
